summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel on November 30, 2018, discussing strategy regarding Jeffrey Epstein. They consider subpoenaing a civil lawyer for deposition transcripts and note the FBI is reviewing the old case file, prompted by another New York Times article.

events.title: US Attorney's Office Strategy Discussion on Epstein
events.description: Personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discuss how to proceed regarding Jeffrey Epstein, including considering subpoenaing a civil lawyer for materials and coordinating with the FBI.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively discussing strategy on the Epstein case on November 30, 2018.
One proposed action was to subpoena the civil lawyer in a case against Epstein for deposition transcripts and other materials.
The FBI was in the process of pulling and reviewing the old Epstein case file at that time.
The discussion was prompted by another article about Epstein in The New York Times.
